bibl.title: Tsunetaro Machida v. Luther Wedin. Notice of Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the district Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Tsunetaro Machida?
For a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
TO THE CLERK OF THE ABOVE ENTITLED COURT, and THE HONORABLE ROBERT O. SAUNDERS, Unted States Attorney for the Western District of Washington:

You, and each of you, will please take notice that Tsunetaro Machida, the petitioner herein, by and through his Attorneys, Thomas R. Horner and Edward Judd, does hereby appeal to the Circuit Court of Appeals of the United States for the Ninth Circuit, from the judgment and decree made and herein on the 26th day of September 1921, sustaining the finding of the Secretary of Labor, and denying the petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus filed herein praying for the discharge of said petitioner, and remanding said petitioner to the custody of the Immigration authorities at Seattle for deportation.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 26th day of September 1921.
Rhomas R. Horner and Edward Judd
Admitted notice and receipt of copy of the above Notice of Appeal is hereby admitted this 26 day of September 1921.
